come_cloudy.title: Come cloudy.
come_cloudy.description: The most fertile minds get cloudy—that's where ideas gestate, where something new is forming. Our favorite collaborators are talented, ambitious leaders in foggy conditions who could use a mirror, divining rod, or compass tune-up—the perfect name for your next solid step forward. We illuminate the unseen. We help you see patterns you can't see from inside, surface what's implicit, translate murky vision into clarity. Leave light-footed.

about_preview.name: Haley Hoffman
about_preview.bio: I've spent 15+ years helping people and organizations navigate significant change. My background spans product strategy (TED.com 2.0 redesign), management consulting (Incandescent, including White House facilitation), and strategic advisory with founders, leaders, and enterprises. I work at the intersection of intuition and analysis. My ongoing creative practice informs how I approach strategic challenges—I help you see familiar problems from new angles and identify solutions that emerge from understanding rather than forcing.

my_story.title: My Story
paragraphs: I've spent my career helping organizations navigate periods of significant change. As the founder of Light Work, I bring a unique combination of strategic vision and intuitive understanding to help leaders see the unseen dynamics within their organizations.
My background spans operational leadership, strategic advising, and organizational design, all informed by my ongoing creative practice and interest in how systems evolve and adapt.
I believe the most valuable insights often emerge from the spaces between conventional metrics—the human dynamics, cultural nuances, and unspoken patterns that shape how organizations function.

how_i_work.title: How I Work
how_i_work.content: I serve as a trusted advisor rather than a traditional consultant. My engagements are designed to be high-impact, focused, and tailored to your specific context. I limit my client roster to ensure deep engagement and availability for each partnership.

process.title: How We Work
process.description: I begin with discovery—part spitballing, part research, part conversation. The work begins immediately, with project design emerging as we unlock insights. Within days, we're boots on the ground together, capturing notes that will inform the next several years of your strategy.

accessibility.content: I believe good counsel should be available to those doing important work. That's why I reserve space each quarter for select sliding scale and scholarship engagements.
